body: Closing the pull request as this was opened by error.

In Falcon we maintain all change log in CHANGES.txt. Since we don't make edits to the commits sent by the users you will also need to update CHANGES.txt (top level)
I haven't reviewed all the command options in detail (mandatory vs. optional parameters) so I hope they are consistent with the old ones. Apart from that and minor nits, the change looks good to me.
LGTM..
+1. Will merge shortly.

@mgreene-atx  There seems to be a lot of check-style issues in your patch. Please fix them.

I think this information is already there in JIRA and should be fetched from JIRA. Maintaining same information in two places can cause discrepancies. Let's keep JIRA as source of truth and fetch information from there.

Seems Jenkins is failing it now for a test that doesn't appear to be related. I'm looking into it but would appreciate an opinion from someone more familiar with the codebase.

I located the checkstyle.xml in addons project. After disabling the DoubleCheckedLocking module, which was removed from Checkstyle in version 5.6 and I am running 6+, I was able to properly load the checkstyle errors and format the code. After that I had to merge with a commit in the upstream master and then I pushed to my FALCON-383 branch.

The reason this is added is because of the following reasons:
1. JIRA Type may not directly map to our categorization, for example, backward incompatible changes. Sub-Task can be a "New feature". So, this lets the committer override the default categorization, if required.
2. It is just part of commit message similar to title, contributor (author) that also can be retrieved from JIRA. It is just making it available in one place as git log.
+1. LGTM.

@mgreene-atx : The reason for failure is not related to your patch.
But anyways, there seems to check style issues still in your pull request. I had applied your patch and ran locally.

I believe this will require more changes:
1. Change method signature of getInstanceResultSubset to indicate numResults is not used. Else, it is misleading. Even better would be if you could move this logic to getInstanceResultSubset as other methods can use it.
2. Make this behavior consistent across all APIs that filter by start time.
3. getRunningInstances uses getInstanceResultSubset. Will need changes there too.
+1. Will merge.

+1. Sorry @PraveenAdlakha , I totally missed your update. Will merge right away.
+1 looks good.
Thanks everyone for the review. Will merge this shortly.

@PraveenAdlakha, a quick search shows that Recipes.twiki has some reference to old FalconCLI. Can you please update that too? ``` $ find . -name "*.twiki" | xargs grep -r FalconCLI | grep -v FalconCLI.twiki ./src/site/twiki/index.twiki:[[falconcli/FalconCLI][Falcon CLI]] implements [[restapi/ResourceList][Falcon's RESTful API]] and ./src/site/twiki/Recipes.twiki:Recipe command usage is defined here. ./src/site/twiki/Recipes.twiki: * Invokes a Tool to substitute the properties in the templated process for the recipe. By default invokes base tool if tool option is not passed. Tool is responsible for generating process entity at the path specified by FalconCLI ./src/site/twiki/Recipes.twiki: * Looks for the patten ##[A-Za-z0-9_.]*## in the templated process and substitutes it with the properties. Process entity generated after the substitution is written to the empty file passed by FalconCLI ```
